instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Randomly reboots around the chime with no battery
threads.message:
If I connect a known good battery I can get it to go past the chime but it doesn't sense the battery correctly.

When power is plugged in an no battery it keeps rebooting randomly.
With battery or battery and power it will make it to unlock screen, but;
    When power is connected the battery reads 100%
    Without power connected, battery reads correct percentage.
    Battery status reports "Not Charging".


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>::17/18 == MOhms.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>::27/28 == 20Ohms.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is stable at 3.3v
PPBUS = 9.06v then drops to ~3v then back up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Randomly reboots around the chime with no battery
threads.message: From your measurements provided, looks like broken trace from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 17/18.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Randomly reboots around the chime with no battery
threads.message: Check your resistors between 17 and 18 sounds like one is blown should get 3 ohms between 17 and 18

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Randomly reboots around the chime with no battery
threads.message:
Seems there was indeed a burnt trace. I ran a jumper and all is well.

Mark solved please.
